{{about|the solar orbiting spacecraft|the NASA experimental aircraft|Helios Prototype|French military photo-reconnaissance satellites|Helios 1B|and|Helios 2 (satellite)}} {{Infobox Spacecraft | Name = Helios A / Helios B | Image = [[Image:Helios spacecraft.jpg|x250px | upright |]] | Caption = Prototype of the Helios spacecraft | Organization = [[NASA]] / [[West Germany|FRG]] | Major_Contractors = [[Messerschmitt-BÃ¶lkow-Blohm|MBB]] | Mission_Type = [[Orbiter]]s | Flyby_Of = | Satellite_Of = [[Sun]] | Launch = '''Helios-A :''' 1974-12-10 07:11:01.5 UTC

({{For year month day| year=1976 | month=1 | day=15 }} ago) | Launch_Vehicle = [[Titan IIIE]] / [[Centaur (rocket stage)|Centaur]] | Launch_Site = [[Cape Canaveral Air Force Station Space Launch Complex 41|Space Launch Complex 41]]
[[Cape Canaveral Air Force Station]] | Orbital_Insertion_Date = | Landing_Site = | Mission_Duration = '''Helios-A :'''

December 23, 1979 | NSSDC_ID = '''Helios-A :''' [http://nssdc.gsfc.nasa.gov/nmc/spacecraftDisplay.do?id=1974-097A 1974-097A]
'''Helios-B :''' [http://nssdc.gsfc.nasa.gov/nmc/spacecraftDisplay.do?id=1976-003A 1976-003A] | nolink = - | Webpage = '''Helios-A :''' [http://solarsystem.nasa.gov/missions/profile.cfm?MCode=Helios_01 NASA Solarsystem Exploration page]
'''Helios-B :''' [http://solarsystem.nasa.gov/missions/profile.cfm?MCode=Helios_02 NASA Solarsystem Exploration page] | Mass = {{convert|370|kg|lb|abbr=on}} | Power = ([[Photovoltaic array|solar array]]) }} ''' ''Helios-A'' ''' and ''' ''Helios-B'' ''' (also known as ''{{nowrap|Helios 1}}'' and ''{{nowrap|Helios 2}}''), were a pair of probes launched into [[heliocentric orbit]] for the purpose of studying [[Sun|solar]] processes. A joint venture of the [[West Germany|Federal Republic of Germany]] ([[West Germany]]) and [[NASA]], the probes were launched from the [[John F. Kennedy Space Center]] at [[Cape Canaveral, Florida]], on Dec. 10, 1974, and Jan. 15, 1976, respectively. The probes are notable for having set a maximum speed record among spacecraft at 252,792 km/h (157,078 mi/h or 43.63 mi/s or 70.22 km/s or 0.000234''[[Speed of light|c]]''). Helios 2 flew three million kilometers closer to the Sun than Helios 1, achieving [[perihelion]] on 17 April 1976 at a record distance of 0.29 AU (or 43.432 million kilometers),[http://solarsystem.nasa.gov/missions/profile.cfm?MCode=Helios_02&Display=ReadMore Solar System Exploration: Missions: By Target: Our Solar System: Past: Helios 2] slightly inside the orbit of [[Mercury (planet)|Mercury]]. Helios 2 was sent into orbit 13 months after the launch of Helios 1. The Helios space probes completed their primary missions by the early 1980s, but they continued to send data up to 1985. The probes are no longer functional but still remain in their elliptical orbit around the Sun. ==Mission background== ====Scientific instruments==== {| class="wikitable" |- ! scope="col" width="135" | Instrument Name ! Description |- |
[[Plasma (physics)|Plasma]] Experiment Investigation
| Measures the velocity and distribution of the solar wind plasma. |- |
Flux-gate [[Magnetometer]]
| Measures the field strength and direction of low frequency magnetic fields in the Sunâs environment. |- |
Search Coil [[Magnetometer]]
| Compliments the Flux-Gate Magnetometer by measuring the magnetic fields between 0 and 3 kHz. |- |
[[Plasma (physics)|Plasma]] Wave Investigation
| |- |
Cosmic Radiation Investigation
| Measures protons, electrons and x-rays to determine the distribution of cosmic rays. |- |
Low-Energy Electron and Ion Spectrometer
| Investigates the higher energy portion of the crossover region between the solar wind particles and the cosmic rays. |- |
Zodiacal Light Photometer
| Measures the scattering of sunlight by interplanetary dust particles. |- |
Micrometeoroid Analyser
| Investigates the composition, charge, mass, velocity and direction of interplanetary dust particles. |} {{Image gallery |width=200 |lines=2 | Helios - launch configuration diagram.png | Launch configuration diagram | Launch configuration diagram. | Helios - testing.png | A technician stands next to one of the twin Helios spacecraft | A technician stands next to one of the twin Helios spacecraft. | Helios - helios2.gif | Inspection of Helios 2 | Inspection of ''Helios-B''. | Helios spacecraft 2.jpg | Helios probe being encapsulated for launch | A ''Helios'' probe being encapsulated for launch. }} ==Mission profile== [[Image:Titan 3E Centaur with Helios 1.jpg| 200px | thumb | right | alt=Helios I sitting atop the [[Titan III|Titan IIIE]] / [[Centaur (rocket stage)|Centaur]] launch vehicle | ''Helios-A'' sitting atop the [[Titan III|Titan IIIE]] / [[Centaur (rocket stage)|Centaur]] launch vehicle.]] ===Launch and trajectory=== {| | [[Image:Helios - Trajectory.png|200px|thumb|right| Trajectory of the Helio space probes | Trajectory of the Helio space probes.]] |} ===Timeline of travel=== {| class="wikitable" ! scope="col" width="100" | Date ! | Closest flyby of the [[Sun]] of any spacecraft, performed by ''Helios II''. |} ==See also== * [[List of vehicle speed records]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category|Helios (spacecraft)}} *[http://nssdc.gsfc.nasa.gov/nmc/spacecraftDisplay.do?id=1974-097A Helios 1 - NSSDC Master Catalog] *[http://nssdc.gsfc.nasa.gov/nmc/spacecraftDisplay.do?id=1976-003A Helios 2 - NSSDC Master Catalog] *[http://solarsystem.nasa.gov/missions/profile.cfm?MCode=Helios_01 Helios 1 Mission Profile] by [http://solarsystem.nasa.gov NASA's Solar System Exploration] *[http://solarsystem.nasa.gov/missions/profile.cfm?MCode=Helios_02 Helios 2 Mission Profile] by [http://solarsystem.nasa.gov NASA's Solar System Exploration] *[http://ntrs.nasa.gov/archive/nasa/casi.ntrs.nasa.gov/19760006052_1976006052.pdf Titan/Centaur D-1T TC-2, Helios A, Flight Data Report] *[http://www.honeysucklecreek.net/dss44/helios.html Honeysuckle Creek Tracking Station] *[http://astronautix.com/craft/helios.htm Astronautix Helios page] {{Sun spacecraft}} {{extreme motion}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Helios Probes}} [[Category:Solar missions]] [[Category:Inactive extraterrestrial probes]] [[Category:Artificial satellites orbiting Sun]] [[Category:Solar telescopes]] [[Category:1974 in spaceflight]] [[Category:1976 in spaceflight]] [[ar:ÙÙÙÙÙØ³]] [[bg:Ð¥ÐµÐ»Ð¸Ð¾Ñ (ÐºÐ¾ÑÐ¼Ð¸ÑÐµÑÐºÐ¸ Ð°Ð¿Ð°ÑÐ°Ñ)]] [[cs:Program Helios]] [[de:Helios (Sonde)]] [[es:Helios (sondas espaciales)]] [[fr:Helios (sonde spatiale)]] [[it:Sonde Helios]] [[hu:Helios-program]] [[nl:Helios-sondes]] [[ja:ããªãªã¹ (æ¢æ»æ©)]] [[pt:Programa HÃ©lios]] [[fi:Helios (avaruusluotain)]] [[sv:Helios (rymdsonder)]]
